meanings.sent1: I love snacking on a cavendish banana in the afternoon.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store always has fresh cavendish bananas in stock.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cavendish banana go to school? To become a banana split!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and inviting as a ripe cavendish banana.
meanings.sent5: The cavendish banana's yellow peel stood out among the green apples.

meanings.sent1: The aroma of cavendish tobacco filled the room.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed smoking a pipe filled with cavendish tobacco.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cavendish tobacco refuse to be lit? It was feeling burnt out!
meanings.sent4: The scent of cavendish tobacco lingered in the air like a sweet memory.
meanings.sent5: The cavendish tobacco leaves rustled in the gentle breeze of the plantation.

meanings.sent1: The cavendish apple tree bore delicious fruits every autumn.
meanings.sent2: She baked a scrumptious pie using cavendish apples from the orchard.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cavendish apple refuse to be eaten? It wanted to be a fruit ninja!
meanings.sent4: The cavendish apple gleamed like a polished gem in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sweet fragrance of cavendish apples filled the kitchen with warmth.
